scene.name: intro
scene.line: Is there any pie left in the break room?
Darryl finished it off before he went home last night.
You're declaring enemies left and right.
That other Márquez woman: "Weaver." Didn't you ... Maybe I misunderstood. I thought I detected some, uh, `animosity`.
Oh, no, nothing like that. She wasn't the kind of person you could "like" or "dislike," really; she was just `there`, and all you could do was accept her. Like magnetism, or gravity.

scene.name: seating
scene.line: Please describe, from memory, the following objects:
Seating, in the room behind you.

scene.name: lighting
scene.line: Lighting, in the room behind you.
scene.option: Buzzing fluorescents, and a standing lamp.

scene.name: air-quality
scene.line: Air quality, in the last room in which you fell asleep.
scene.option: My workshop is poorly ventilated. It smells like solder and burnt plastic.
I think I fell asleep on the boat for a minute. The air was warm but refreshing.
I don't remember where I last fell asleep.

scene.name: after-questions
scene.line: Well, `this` Márquez is pretty normal, so far.
Oh yeah, they're definitely different people. I just wonder if they're related or something. I never imagined Weaver having any family, but I guess everyone has `some` family, right?
OK. Let's go on to the next test.
